intro: Bellevalia millingenii, commonly known as the Millingen's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It produces narrow, grass-like leaves and has a compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
